meanings.sent1: I will preschedule our meeting for next week.
meanings.sent2: She always preschedules her appointments to avoid any conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The robot prescheduled its daily maintenance, but forgot to charge itself!
meanings.sent4: His habit of prescheduling every task made him feel like a time traveler.
meanings.sent5: Prescheduling your tasks can help you stay organized and efficient.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging or planning beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The prescheduling of events helped avoid any last-minute chaos.
meanings.sent2: Prescheduling is essential for a smooth workflow in the office.
meanings.sent3: The prescheduling of the party made it feel like a surprise event!
meanings.sent4: Her detailed prescheduling was like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The prescheduling of the project ensured timely completion.
